subject: Public Speaking
title: Primacy and Recency Effects
description: A fast breakdown of Primacy and Recency Effects for builders.

hook.text: People remember the first and last things you say. The middle fades.

buildup.text: This is why openings and closings matter most in speeches.

discovery.text: The serial position effect is well-documented in psychology.

twist.text: Smart speakers put key messages at start and end.

climax.text: Structure speeches knowing the middle will be partially forgotten.

punchline.text: Front-load and end-load. The middle fades.

quiz.question: What are primacy and recency?
options: People remember firsts and lasts best
